DOC.brief_summary: We wish to find out if in non-diabetic pregnancies, as well as diabetic pregnancies, additional data obtained by Continuous Glucose Monitoring improves perinatal risk prediction.
DOC.brief_title: Correlation Between Continuous Glucose Monitoring and Intermittent Glucose Monitoring Values and Pregnancy Outcomes
DOC.detailed_description: Patients are recruited for 3 day continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) plus self-blood glucose monitoring followed by routine diabetes screening at 26-28 weeks gestation to determine if maternal blood glucose excursions correlate with deviation from optimized birth weight.
DOC.criteria: Pregnant patients under 28 weeks gestation Pregestational diabetes
